skill.name: ghe-transition
skill.description:
CHANGE phases in the GitHub Elements workflow. Closes current thread and opens next phase thread. This is a PHASE CHANGE operation, not just saving progress.

USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User says "transition to TEST" or "move to REVIEW"
- User says "I'm done with DEV, start TEST" or "DEV complete"
- User says "advance to next phase" or "close this phase"
- User says "demote to DEV" (from TEST or REVIEW)
- User says "tests pass, ready for review"
- User says "merge this" (after REVIEW PASS)
- User explicitly wants to END current phase and BEGIN next

DO NOT USE THIS SKILL WHEN:
- User just wants to SEE status (use ghe-status)
- User wants to START work on new issue (use ghe-claim)
- User wants to SAVE progress but CONTINUE working (use ghe-checkpoint)
- User wants reports (use ghe-report)
- User is not ready to END current phase

IMPORTANT: This CLOSES current thread and OPENS next thread. Use ghe-checkpoint if you just want to save progress without changing phases.

EXAMPLES:
<example>
Context: DEV work complete, ready for testing
user: "I'm done with DEV, transition to TEST"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to close DEV and open TEST thread"
</example>
<example>
Context: All tests pass, ready for review
user: "Tests pass, move to REVIEW"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to close TEST and open REVIEW thread"
</example>
<example>
Context: Structural issues found in TEST
user: "This needs structural changes, demote to DEV"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to demote from TEST back to DEV"
</example>
<example>
Context: REVIEW passed, ready to merge
user: "REVIEW passed, merge it"
assistant: "I'll use ghe-transition to complete the workflow and merge"
</example>

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and workflow instructions. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or external command execution capabilities detected. This is a safe workflow management skill.

content.value_statement: Managing phase transitions manually creates confusion about which issues are in which state. This skill automates closing one workflow phase and opening the next, ensuring clean handoffs between development, testing, and review stages.
actual_capabilities: Close current GitHub thread and open next phase thread
Validate transition readiness with phase-gate agent
Update SERENA memory bank after transition
limitations: Requires GitHub Elements workflow system to be configured
Cannot perform invalid phase transitions (DEVâ†’REVIEW, REVIEWâ†’TEST)
Does not create or modify code, only manages workflow state
Requires pending-promotion label for phase transitions

use_cases.title: Handoff Completed Features
use_cases.description: Move completed development work from DEV to TEST phase, ensuring proper documentation and test requirements are met before testing begins.

use_cases.title: Promote Passed Tests
use_cases.description: Transition validated tests from TEST to REVIEW phase, signaling that work is ready for code review by the team.

use_cases.title: Merge Approved Changes
use_cases.description: Complete the workflow by merging approved changes from REVIEW phase, with proper traceability to all previous phases.

faq.question: What phases are supported in GitHub Elements?
faq.answer: GitHub Elements supports three phases: DEV (development), TEST (quality assurance), and REVIEW (code review). Transitions go forward through these phases or backward via demotion.

faq.question: What happens if phase-gate validation fails?
faq.answer: The transition is blocked. You will receive a reason for the failure, such as missing completion comments, incomplete tests, or unmet criteria. Fix the issues before retrying.

faq.question: Can I transition from REVIEW back to TEST?
faq.answer: No, REVIEW can only transition to DEV (demotion) or merge (PASS verdict). Direct REVIEWâ†’TEST transitions are invalid in the workflow.

faq.question: Is my data safe during phase transitions?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill only manages workflow state by closing and opening GitHub issue threads. It does not modify, delete, or exfiltrate any code or project data.

faq.question: Why was my transition request rejected?
faq.answer: Common reasons include: missing 'pending-promotion' label, incomplete test documentation, missing completion summary in current thread, or invalid phase transition path.

faq.question: How does this differ from ghe-checkpoint?
faq.answer: ghe-checkpoint saves progress without changing phases. ghe-transition closes one phase thread and opens the next. Use checkpoint for ongoing work, transition for handoffs.
